trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of remifentanil on electroencephalographic BAR index during propofol anaesthesia
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised study to evaluate the effects of remifentanil on the monitoring of anaesthetic depth with the BAR index or BIS during propofol anaesthesia

interventions.interventions: Remifentanil effect-site target 2 or 4 ng/ml during induction of anaesthesia with propofol
interventions.comparator: Remifentanil effect-site target 0 (control) ng/ml during induction of anaesthesia with propofol

primaryOutcome.outcome: Depth of anaesthesia (loss of eyelash reflex, response to command or painful stimulation) during induction of anaesthesia
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed every 5 minutes during slow induction of anaesthesia with propofol until loss of response to painful stimulation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Propofol concentrations and EEG measures preventing 50% of patients from responding during induction of anaesthesia.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed every 5 minutes during slow induction of anaesthesia with propofol until loss of response to painful stimulation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: ASA physical status 1-3 presenting for elective surgery under GA.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients with EEG abnormalities will not be included.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: These data were not published because the quality of the EEG data was very poor. This was due to equipment malfunction.
